intro: Cynoglossum laeve, commonly known as broadleaf forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. Its showy flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to gardens and natural habitats.
